str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.

The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To come, go.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
And, even, also, namely.

str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.

A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

str2: Who, which, what, that.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

str2: To sit, be seated, enthroned; I dwell, reside. From kata; and hemai; to sit down; figuratively, to remain, reside.

The foot. A primary word; a 'foot'.

str2: To be of sound mind, be sober-minded, exercise self-control. From sophron; to be of sound mind, i.e. Sane, moderate.

str2: From phobos; to frighten, i.e. to be alarmed; by analogy, to be in awe of, i.e. Revere.
